name: lunatic pistol
description: A standard issue LDC pistol with burst-fire capability.  This belongs to an intermediate tier between old human weapons adapted with Lunarian technology and Lunarian tech proper weaponized, as noted by the very wide trumpet-like muzzle and (artificial) bunny ears on top of it.  For that reason, it's mostly incompatible with human tools and modifications.  It's powered by the spiritual energy of the user.

name: lunar service rifle
description: A standard issue bolt-action LDC rifle with an integrated bayonet.  The design is based on an old human weapon, fabricated by and upgraded with Lunarian technology.  For that reason, it's mostly compatible with human tools and modifications.  It's powered by the spiritual energy of the user.
//: The SSiB training rifle is either based on a Mosin or the Japanese Type 89 that used 'type 38 chamber in 7.62×38mmR tracer' according to some post on Reddit. However, Type 89 doesn't seem to exist, only the Type 38 (6.5×50mm Arisaka) or 99 (7.7×58mm Arisaka), which is the one I'll use as basis

name: lunar riot shotgun (vacuum mode)
description: The "Boudou Sandanjou" is an revolving LDC auto shotgun.  This belongs to an intermediate tier between old human weapons adapted with Lunarian technology and Lunarian tech proper weaponized, as noted by the extremely wide barrel.  Alongside the normal shotgun operation, the weapon is capable of generating vacuum in the action mechanism to release short, powerful blasts after pulling the trigger.  Switching between modes is done by activating a button in the thumbhole.

use_action.msg: You switch between modes, allowing your weapon to consume shotgun ammo.

name: lunar riot shotgun (shot mode)
description: The "Boudou Sandanjou" is an revolving LDC auto shotgun.  This belongs to an intermediate tier between old human weapons adapted with Lunarian technology and Lunarian tech proper weaponized, as noted by the extremely wide barrel.  Alongside the normal shotgun operation, the weapon is capable of generating vacuum in the action mechanism to release powerful, short ranged blasts after pulling the trigger.  Switching between modes is done by activating a button in the thumbhole.

use_action.msg: You switch between modes, allowing your weapon to generate vacuum.

name: lunar scouting rifle
description: The "Chakuriku Gyokuto" is a modular bolt-action LDC rifle.  Like other Lunarian pattern guns, this is based on an old human weapon, fabricated by and upgraded with Lunarian technology.  Intended to be used by scouting and first wave forces, it's characterized by it's relatively compact size and the modular nature of its parts.

name: lunar handheld artillery
description: The "Suitou Taihou" is a handheld LDC artillery device.  This belongs to an intermediate tier between old human weapons adapted with Lunarian technology and Lunarian tech proper weaponized, revealed by the extreme miniaturization done in order to fabricate a personal cannon.  It's loaded by unscrewing the handle on top, making it look very similar to a thermos.
//: 9 * 30 cm thermos, the barrel is ~25 cm long

description: The "WIP" is a automatic LDC rifle.  This is an example of weaponized Lunarian tech, given a container in the shape of a weapon for better handling in the field.  It's characterized by the somewhat wide, long barrel featuring a seven-pointed, star-shaped straight grooves.  The action mechanism's inner workings are not identified.
//: Similar shape as the Mk47 Mutant, the barrel is fully metallic, longer and thiner

description: The "WIP" is a semi-automatic LDC rifle.  This is an example of weaponized Lunarian tech, given a container in the shape of a weapon for better handling in the field.  This weapon looks indistinguishable from any battle rifle from the outside, but once opened it reveals intrincated, overlapping mechanisms moving on the same space, and then receding back.

The "WIP" is an automatic interpreter LDC rifle.  This is an example of weaponized Lunarian tech, given a container in the shape of a weapon for better handling in the field.  The mechanism "reads" the ammo data, generates the 5-dimensional bullet component inside and propels it through the barrel, which looks like a solid rod from a 3-dimensional space.  The weapon's frame enables attaching a special side module, on the side of your preference.  The overall look with soft curves can only be described as snug.
//: 'generates' used due a lack of a better word, each ofuda has the 'bullet' component stored and is consumed in the process of the release, leaving it as a blank piece of paper
//2: Modules should allow trippy stuff: changing damage to elemental types, having a chance to not consume ammo, cc the target at the cost of a chunk of damage, extra pain to the target, etc

description: The "WIP" is a special operations semi-auto LDC SMG.  The weapon looks very compact, with intrincated, bright linear branching designs engraved all over it.  It feeds from the user's psychic energy, focusing it on the target to deal damage (analogous to a magnifying glass), being thus closer to an assisting tool than a proper weapon.
//2: *total* dispersion should be that value once mana drain is in place, as it's basically a hitscan weapon
//3: When used by non-Gyokuto it should debuff the user by giving headaches, things like that. When used by non-elite Gyokuto it should consume rnd(1.5-2) times more mana
//4: Stat loss should affect this weapon way more, i.e. DEX or PER red numbers when using it should translate to worse-than-usual penalties
